00042 
00043 CSV::~CSV()
00044 {
00045         if (m_orig_file)
00046         {
00047                 delete m_orig_file;
00048                 m_orig_file = NULL;
00049         }
00050 }
00051 
00052 
00053 CSV::CSV(const TCHAR* filename)
00054 {
00055         m_orig_file = NULL;
00056         m_length = 0;
00057 
00058         FILE *csvFile = fopen(filename, "r");
00059         assert(csvFile);
00060 
00061         // Grab the length of the file and allocate a buffer
00062         fseek(csvFile, 0, SEEK_END);
00063         m_length = ftell(csvFile);
00064         fseek(csvFile, 0, SEEK_SET);
00065         
00066         // Allocate a buffer and read the file
00067         m_orig_file = new char[m_length];
00068         assert(m_orig_file);
00069         fread(m_orig_file, m_length, 1, csvFile);
00070         fclose(csvFile);
00071 }
00072 
00073 void CSV::ParseItem(char const * const line, int const _item, char *output) const
00074 {
00075         int item = _item;
00076         char buffer[256];
00077         char *str;
00078         char seps[]   = " ,\t\r\n=";
00079 
00080         strcpy(buffer, line);
00081         str = strtok(buffer, seps);
00082         while (item > 0)
00083         {
00084                 str = strtok(NULL, seps);
00085                 --item;
00086         }
00087         strcpy(output, str);
00088 }
00089 
00090 
00091 void CSV::ReadLine(char const * const section, char const * const line, char *output) const
00092 {
00093         char *buffer = new char[m_length];
00094         assert(buffer);
00095 
00096         char *tmpBuffer;
00097         char seps[]   = " ,\t\r\n=";
00098         char newLine[] = "\r\n";
00099         size_t len;
00100 
00101         memcpy(buffer, m_orig_file, m_length);
00102         tmpBuffer = strtok( buffer, newLine );
00103         len = strlen(section);
00104 
00105         // Find the section header.
00106         // Assumption: Section will be found or loop won't end.
00107         while ((strlen(tmpBuffer) < len) || (_strnicmp(tmpBuffer, section, len)))
00108         {
00109                 tmpBuffer = strtok(NULL, newLine);
00110                 assert(tmpBuffer);
00111         }
00112 
00113         // Get the first line in the section.
00114         tmpBuffer = strtok(NULL, newLine);
00115 
00116         bool success = false;
00117 
00118         while (tmpBuffer)
00119         {
00120                 // Ignore commented lines and blank lines.
00121                 if ((tmpBuffer[0] == ';') || (tmpBuffer[0] == ' '))
00122                 {
00123                         // Non match. Continue search.
00124                         tmpBuffer = strtok( NULL, newLine );
00125                         continue;
00126                 }
00127 
00128                 len = strlen(line);
00129                 if ((strlen(tmpBuffer) > len) && (_strnicmp(tmpBuffer, line, len) == 0) &&
00130                                 ((tmpBuffer[len] == ',') ||
00131                                 (tmpBuffer[len] == '\t') ||
00132                                 (tmpBuffer[len] == '\r') ||
00133                                 (tmpBuffer[len] == '\n') ||
00134                                 (tmpBuffer[len] == '='))
00135                         )
00136                 {
00137                         // Found entry. Exit loop.
00138                         tmpBuffer = strtok( tmpBuffer, seps );
00139                         tmpBuffer = strtok( NULL, newLine );
00140                         strcpy(output, tmpBuffer);
00141                         tmpBuffer = NULL;
00142                         success = true;
00143                 }
00144                 else
00145                 {
00146                         // Non match. Continue search.
00147                         tmpBuffer = strtok( NULL, newLine );
00148                 }
00149         }
00150 
00151         assert(success && "The entry was not found");
00152 
00153         delete buffer;
00154 }

00157 // Return an integer stored in the file.
00158 int const CSV::GetInt(char const * const entry, const int& item) const
00159 {
00160         return GetInt( "[Integer]", entry, item );
00161 }//end GetInt
00162 
00163 
00164 // Return boolean
00165 bool const CSV::GetBool(char const * const entry) const
00166 {
00167         return ( GetInt( "[Bool]", entry, 0 ) != 0 );
00168 }
00169 
00170 // Return an integer stored in the file in a section other than the Integer section
00171 int const CSV::GetInt(char const * const section, char const * const entry, const int& item) const
00172 {
00173         int retVal;
00174 
00175         char buffer[256];
00176         char str[256];
00177         ReadLine(section, entry, buffer);
00178         ParseItem(buffer, item, str);
00179 
00180         // Check for an enum if it's a string.
00181         if ((str[0] >= '0' && str[0] <= '9') || (str[0] == '-'))
00182         {
00183                 retVal = atoi(str);
00184         }
00185         else
00186         {
00187                 retVal = GetEnum( str );
00188         }
00189 
00190         return retVal;
00191 }//end GetInt
00192 
00193 
00194 
00195 // Return a string stored in the file.
00196 // Commas in string are not used as separators.
00197 void CSV::GetString(char const * const entry, char *outputString) const
00198 {
00199         char intSection[] = "[String]";
00200 
00201         char buffer[256];
00202         ReadLine(intSection, entry, buffer);
00203         strcpy(outputString, buffer);
00204 }
00205 
00206 
00207 int CSV::GetEnum(char const * const entry) const
00208 {
00209         char intSection[] = "[Enum]";
00210 
00211         char buffer[256];
00212         ReadLine(intSection, entry, buffer);
00213         return atoi(buffer);
00214 }
